bibl.title: William W. Tinkham and Annie Ll. Tinkham v. David E. Kimble and A.B. Corriell. Complaint
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Justice Court of Mount Vernon Precinct County of Skagit, Territory of Washington

body.p: Territory of Washington } ss County of Skagit

William W. Tinkham of said County and Territory being first duly sworn on oath deposes and says that on Sunday the 28 day of August 1887, he, the said William W. Tinkham and Annie Ll. Tinkham being then and there peaceably within said county and Territory certain persons to wit: David R. Kimble and A.B. Corriell did then and there and in an angry and threatening manner and being armed with a double barreled shot gun carries in the hands of said David E. Kimble, did threaten to do great bodily injury to the said William W. Tinkham and Annie Ll. Tinkham, to wit; to beat strike and kill said William W. Tinkham and Annie Ll. Tinkham
Said that he, the said William W. Tinkham, has just cause to fear and dose fear that
said David E. Kimble and A.B. Corriell will do the acts threatened to wit; will beat strike or kill the said William W. Tinkham and Annie L. Tinkham as they threatened to do.
Subscribed and Sworn to before me this 31st day of August 1887
John T. Mason Justice of the Peace
In the Justice Court of Mount Vernon Precinct County of Skagit Territory of Washington
Territory of Washington Plaintiff vs David E. Kimble A.B. Corriell Defendants
